Description: Apron of cowrie shells, snail shell and glass beads with a fringe of leather strands.
Curator's comments: See also Af1912,0410.81 Register 1939 later addition: '"Nubian", of Sudan - cf 1912.4-10 (MAC)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Captain Tristram C S Speedy
Acquisition notes: From the collection of Capt.T.C.Speedy, the interpreter of the British Expedition to Abyssinia, 1867-68. The apron was not made in Abyssinia, and may have been collected en route from or to Egypt.
